alert.note: Alert for Cass; Johnson; Lancaster; Otoe (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 11 at 3:22AM CST until January 13 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 PM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM FRIDAY TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SATURDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. The coldest wind chills are expected Saturday night into Sunday morning. * WHERE...Cass, Johnson, Lancaster, and Otoe Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 3 PM this afternoon to 9 PM CST Friday. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon CST Friday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM Friday to 6 PM CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM Saturday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be hazardous. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, even after snow has stopped falling. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday evening and Friday commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
